description.narrative: Support to women's empowerment in milk processing and marketing This four-month project aims to reduce socio-economic inequalities between men and women through the promotion of income-generating activities for 120 women from 3 economic interest groups in the peri-urban area of the country. communal district 2 of Niamey in the local milk value chain. The goal will be to equip women with smallprocessing units for dairy products and to strengthen their management and other skills, as well as organizational leadership to enable them to carry out collective activities. This will help to increase their social status within their households and communitiesthrough the financial contribution they will make. Ultimately, this will open the way to involvement inthe decision-making process at the household and community level.

participating-org.narrative: Jeunesse Africaine et Actions de de pement

The NGO "African Youth and Development Actions" (JAAD) was created in 2012 and officially recognized on 23/09/2014 byArrêté N ° 649/ MISPD / DAPJ / DLP of 23/09/2014 Registration in the Official Journal N ° 1 of 1/1/2015, PAT N ° 00596/2011 / DONGAD. The spirit that animates the founders of JAAD is to offer their services by simple dedication for the benefit of the entire population of Nigerin general. It is headquartered in Niamey and has regional entities. In accordance with its revised statutes and adopted by the General Assembly held in Niamey on January 1, 2014, JAAD is a decentralized organization. The organs of JAAD are: On a national level : the general Assembly the National Executive Bureau At the regional level, it will consist of a Regional Office represented by the Regional Coordinator or a representative. Future Vision To become a reference organization to contribute to the construction of a society without inequalities based on gender. For its service sales component (executing agency), JAAD can intervene anywhere in Niger and possibly even outside Niger. JAAD also wants to be a reference NGO in its organization and working methods for sustainable development. 3. JAAD goal To work for the intellectual, social, cultural and economic development of Nigerian and African women through the production and dissemination of women's knowledge and know-how. Values: Fairness, Transparency, Excellence, Teamwork, Solidarity,Innovation, Accountability; Vision: It consists in effectively promoting the rational management of natural resources and actively contributing to the strengthening of civil society and the population in general. 4. General objectives: The NGO-JAAD has the following general objectives: Transforming the relationship between men and women for greater equity; Promote women's participation in decisions that affect their lives; Work towards a genuine promotion of Nigerian women; Achieve sustainable change by seeking optimal conditions for increased access for women to decision-making in order to overcome hunger, poverty, disease and create the best conditions for lasting peace in our country faced with the recurrence of many challenges. Improve the living conditions of grassroots communities by rationalizing the potential of the area of ##intervention, value feminine leadership from a feminist perspective; To fightactively and effectively against all forms of environmental degradation namely desertification, pollution and nuisances, insalubrity, To fight actively and effectively against poverty, Fight actively and effectively against food insecurity, Promote good governance, Develop a sense of citizenship and democracy through animation and awareness for their self promotion. To reach the maximum of financial autonomy by the NGO, 5. Our JAAD Intervention Strategies Capacity Building ; Research and dissemination; Advocacy Networking; Resource mobilization; Creation of strategic partnerships; 6. Institutional capacity 'JAAD' plans to scale to national and international coverage. It has a strategic plan, action, work, monitoring and evaluation. She is a member of several collective committees,national and international networks (PLS Sahel Leadership Program, Women Living Under Muslim Law WLUM, National Network for Monitoring Evaluation RENSE, Community of Good Practice in Results-Based Management COPNIGER etc.) She has skills that are safe and available to succeed in the mission she has given herself. The human resources of JAAD 'JAAD' has 15 active members, 70 sympathizing members and 5 affiliated grassroots groups. There are several specialists: economists, engineer statisticians economists, sociologists, foresters, lawyers, managers, agronomists, educators, social assistants, to whom are associated various technicians and experienced animators and specialized supervisors.
7. Intervention strategies As a civil society organization, ONG'JAAD 'works to strengthen the technical, organizational and economic capacities of grassroots communitiesin a horizontal approach. It cultivates the spirit of partnership and complementarity both with rural communities and with all stakeholders in their field. The intervention strategies of ONG'JAAD 'consist of: Adopt a participatory approach
